meanings.definition: To move or position troops or equipment strategically.
meanings.sent1: The general was deploying his soldiers along the border for defense.
meanings.sent2: The army was deploying their tanks to the front lines.
meanings.sent3: The troops were deploying in a formation that looked like a giant arrow.
meanings.sent4: She was deploying her chess pieces on the board, planning her next move carefully.
meanings.sent5: The workers were deploying the scaffolding around the building, preparing for construction.

meanings.sent1: The manager was deploying new strategies to improve sales.
meanings.sent2: The team was deploying their skills to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The chef was deploying his secret recipe to impress the food critics.
meanings.sent4: She was deploying her charm to win over the difficult client.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was deploying creative methods to engage her students in learning.

meanings.definition: To spread out or arrange strategically.
meanings.sent1: The event planner was deploying the tables and chairs for the wedding reception.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was deploying the plants in a way that created a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent3: The children were deploying their toys around the room in an organized manner.
meanings.sent4: She was deploying the ingredients on the counter before starting to cook.
meanings.sent5: The artist was deploying the colors on the canvas to create a stunning painting.
